events.originalText: Approximately 10,000 John Deere employees went on strike in one of the largest private-sector strikes in the United States.
events.subtitle: John Deere
events.headline: 10,000 John Deere Employees Strike in the US

events.originalText: A snowstorm and series of avalanches occurred on and around the Himalayan peaks of Annapurna and Dhaulagiri, resulting in the deaths of at least 43 people.
events.subtitle: 2014 Nepal snowstorm disaster
events.headline: 43 Dead in Himalayan Snowstorm and Avalanches

events.originalText: Felix Baumgartner jumped from a helium balloon in the stratosphere to become the first person to break the sound barrier without vehicular power.
events.subtitle: Felix Baumgartner
events.headline: Felix Baumgartner Breaks Sound Barrier in Stratosphere

events.originalText: Michael Woodford was dismissed as the CEO of the optics manufacturer Olympus after uncovering internal financial misconduct, escalating the corporate scandal into one of the largest in Japanese business history.
events.subtitle: Michael Christopher Woodford
events.headline: Olympus CEO Dismissed Over Financial Misconduct

events.originalText: The 6th Congress of the Workers' Party concluded, having anointed North Korean president Kim Il Sung's son Kim Jong Il as his successor.
events.subtitle: 6th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea
events.headline: Kim Jong Il Anointed as North Korean President's Successor

events.originalText: At least 75,000 people attended the National March on Washington for Lesbian and Gay Rights in Washington, D.C., to demand equal civil rights for LGBT people.
events.subtitle: National March on Washington for Lesbian and Gay Rights
events.headline: 75,000 Attend National March for LGBT Rights in Washington, D.C.

events.originalText: Members of the Politburo voted to remove Nikita Khrushchev as First Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union and replace him with Leonid Brezhnev.
events.subtitle: Politburo of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union
events.headline: Nikita Khrushchev Removed as First Secretary of Soviet Union

events.originalText: After three days of heavy rain, the Turia overflowed and flooded the city of Valencia, Spain, causing at least 81 deaths.
events.subtitle: Turia (river)
events.headline: Valencia, Spain Flooded, 81 Dead After Heavy Rain

events.originalText: The Queen Elizabeth Way, North America's first intercity divided highway, opens.
events.subtitle: Queen Elizabeth Way
events.headline: Queen Elizabeth Way, First Intercity Divided Highway in North America, Opens

events.originalText: B. R. Ambedkar, a leader of India's "Untouchable" caste, publicly converted to Buddhism and became the leader of the Dalit Buddhist movement.
events.subtitle: B. R. Ambedkar
events.headline: B. R. Ambedkar Converts to Buddhism, Leads Dalit Buddhist Movement

events.originalText: Israeli military commander Ariel Sharon and his Unit 101 special forces attacked the village of Qibya on the West Bank, destroying 45 buildings, killing 42 villagers, and wounding 15 others.
events.subtitle: Ariel Sharon
events.headline: Ariel Sharon Attacks Village in West Bank, 42 Killed

events.originalText: The first of the Smith Act trials concluded in New York City, with eleven leaders of the Communist Party of the United States found guilty of violating the Smith Act.
events.subtitle: Smith Act trials of Communist Party leaders
events.headline: Communist Party Leaders Found Guilty in Smith Act Trials

events.originalText: American test pilot Chuck Yeager became the first person to break the sound barrier, reaching Mach 1.06 on board the Bell X-1, an experimental rocket-powered aircraft.
events.subtitle: Chuck Yeager
events.headline: Chuck Yeager Breaks Sound Barrier on Bell X-1 Aircraft

events.originalText: World War II: During the second raid on Schweinfurt, the U.S. 8th Air Force suffered so many losses that it lost air supremacy over Germany for several months.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: U.S. 8th Air Force Loses Air Supremacy Over Germany in WWII Raid

events.originalText: The Holocaust: Prisoners at Sobibor extermination camp revolted, killing 11 SS officers and staging a mass escape.
events.subtitle: The Holocaust
events.headline: Sobibor Prisoners Revolt, Kill 11 SS Officers

events.originalText: The Second Philippine Republic, a Japanese puppet state, was established with Jose P. Laurel as its first president.
events.subtitle: Second Philippine Republic
events.headline: Second Philippine Republic Established with Jose P. Laurel as President

events.originalText: Second World War: During the Blitz, a semi-armour-piercing fragmentation bomb fell on the road above Balham station in London, which was being used as an air raid shelter, killing at least 64 people.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: 64 Killed in Balham Station Bombing During Blitz

events.originalText: Second World War: The German submarine U-47 torpedoed and sank the Royal Navy battleship HMS Royal Oak while the latter was anchored at Scapa Flow in Orkney, Scotland.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: HMS Royal Oak Sunk by German U-Boat in Orkney, Scotland

events.originalText: The first book featuring English author A. A. Milne's fictional bear Winnie-the-Pooh was published.
events.subtitle: Winnie-the-Pooh (book)
events.headline: First Winnie-the-Pooh Book Published by A. A. Milne

events.originalText: The worst mining accident in the United Kingdom's history took place when an explosion resulted in 440 deaths at the Universal Colliery in Senghenydd, Wales.
events.subtitle: Mining accident
events.headline: 440 Dead in Universal Colliery Mining Accident in Wales

events.originalText: Former U.S. president Theodore Roosevelt was shot in an assassination attempt, but delivered a speech before receiving treatment from preeminent surgeon John Benjamin Murphy.
events.subtitle: Theodore Roosevelt
events.headline: Theodore Roosevelt Shot in Assassination Attempt

events.originalText: French inventor Louis Le Prince filmed Roundhay Garden Scene (featured), the earliest surviving motion picture, in Leeds, England.
events.subtitle: Louis Le Prince
events.headline: Earliest Surviving Motion Picture Filmed in Leeds, England

events.originalText: French inventor Louis Le Prince filmed Roundhay Garden Scene (featured), the earliest surviving motion picture, in Leeds, England.
events.subtitle: Louis Le Prince
events.headline: Union Victory in Battle of Bristoe Station During American Civil War

events.originalText: American Civil War: In the Battle of Bristoe Station, the Union II Corps surprised and repelled the Confederate attack on the Union rearguard, resulting in a Union victory.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: French Forces Defeat Austrians in War of the Third Coalition

events.originalText: War of the Third Coalition: French forces under Marshal Michel Ney defeated Austrian forces in Elchingen, present-day Germany.
events.subtitle: War of the Third Coalition
events.headline: Austrians Overwhelm Prussians at Battle of Hochkirch in Third Silesian War

events.originalText: Third Silesian War: At the Battle of Hochkirch, an Austrian army under Leopold Joseph von Daun surprised the Prussians commanded by Frederick the Great, overwhelming them and forcing a general retreat.
events.subtitle: Third Silesian War
events.headline: Burmese Forces Depart for Invasion of Ayutthaya Kingdom

events.originalText: Third Silesian War: At the Battle of Hochkirch, an Austrian army under Leopold Joseph von Daun surprised the Prussians commanded by Frederick the Great, overwhelming them and forcing a general retreat.
events.subtitle: Third Silesian War
events.headline: William the Conqueror Defeats English Army at Hastings, Kills Harold Godwinson

events.originalText: Forces of the Burmese Toungoo dynasty led by King Tabinshwehti (depicted) departed Martaban to begin an invasion of the Ayutthaya Kingdom.
events.subtitle: Toungoo dynasty

events.originalText: Norman conquest: William the Conqueror's forces defeated the English army at Hastings and killed Harold Godwinson (depicted), the last crowned Anglo-Saxon king of England.
events.subtitle: Norman Conquest
